DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Procedure Personal Medical History Physical Examination Digital Rectal Examination Performed Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a personal medical history (a record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual), physical examination (a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment), and digital rectal examination (an examination in which a doctor inserts a lubricated, gloved finger into the rectum to feel for abnormalities), was performed as methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability._the yes/no indicator related to a patient's diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Procedure Personal Medical History Physical Examination Digital Rectal Examination Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the personal medical history (a record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual), physical examination (a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment), and digital rectal examination (an examination in which a doctor inserts a lubricated, gloved finger into the rectum to feel for abnormalities), having been performed as methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredName: Personal Medical History Physical Examination Digital Rectal Examination Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.:Digital rectal examination.  An examination in which a doctor inserts a lubricated, gloved finger into the rectum to feel for abnormalities.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
